intro: Fumaria thuretii, commonly known as the Thuret's smokeplant, is a herbaceous annual plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that resemble smoke. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Fumaria thuretii thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands, along roadsides, and in waste areas.
